definitions.definition: the whole of space and everything in it, including the earth, the planets and the stars

examples.text: Could there be intelligent life elsewhere in the universe?
theories of how the universe began
As far as we know, the entire universe was created in the big bang.
Do you believe God created the universe?
the outer regions of the known universe

definitions.definition: a system of stars, planets, etc. in space outside our own

examples.text: The idea of a **parallel universe** is hard to grasp.
He lives in a little universe of his own.
A tidal pool is its own little universe, bustling with activity and life.

definitions.definition: a particular area of experience or activity

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French univers or Latin universum, neuter of universus ‘combined into one, whole’, from uni- ‘one’ + versus ‘turned’ (past participle of vertere).
